Whatever you think of Will Smith's time in Atlanta, his run through the 2021 postseason is one of the defining performances of that World Series championship team. He closed out every #Braves victory – 11 appearances, 11 scoreless innings, 2 wins, 6 saves, 0.00 ERA, .139 BAA. https://t.co/VbPlTPqmGq
On behalf of Braves Country, thank you Will ❤️ https://t.co/m5KNAtR6H9
Welcome to Atlanta, Robbie and Jake! https://t.co/TpiPkcjN6o

Most lucrative deal in @Braves franchise history.

Austin Riley signs a 10-year, $212 million contract with a 2033 club option. https://t.co/BFY61WGGZP
Having Austin Riley, Matt Olson, Ronald Acuña Jr and Ozzie Albies all locked up for the foreseeable future at a combined ~$65M a year is amazing.
The Atlanta #Braves today signed 3B Austin Riley to a 10-year contract worth $212 million: https://t.co/TdPVtpYnL5

Incredible. 25 yo pizza delivery man runs into burning house, saves four children who tell him another might be in the house. He goes back in, finds the girl, jumps out a window with her, and carries her to a cop who captures the moment on his bodycam https://t.co/cNitkSYtAd https://t.co/ID36BcpAEJ

Arizona’s second-round selection of Ivan Melendez has officially extended the MLB Draft streak belonging to @TexasBaseball. The Longhorns have had at least one player taken in every draft since the very first one in 1965. That is a 57-year run. #HookEm

There he goes. The @Dbacks take @d1baseball Player of the Year Ivan Melendez No. 42 overall. He goes from a 16th rounder to the Marlins last season to a second rounder this spring. Huge raw power, good eye at the plate, has been solid at first base. @TexasBaseball #MLBDraft

El Rey.
The Hispanic Titanic.
Diamondback.

@ivanmelendez17_ has been selected No. 43 overall by the @Dbacks!
